alert.note: Alert for South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 30 at 2:10PM MST until January 01 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 3 AM FRIDAY TO 5 AM MST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches possible. Dangerously cold wind chills as low as minus 20 expected late Friday night and early Saturday. * WHERE...Southern Laramie Range and adjacent foothills including Interstate 80 between Laramie and Cheyenne. The heaviest snow is expected to fall above 7500 feet over the southern Laramie Range. * WHEN...3 AM Friday until 5 AM MST Saturday. Some snow will fall late tonight and early Friday with the main period of heavier snow occurring Friday night into early Saturday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to icy, snow covered roads and reduced visibilities in falling and blowing snow. Dangerously cold wind chills may lead to frost bite or hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: South Laramie Range; South Laramie Range Foothills
